def find_surpasser_counts(arr, n):
    d = {}

    def merge(l, m, r):
        L = arr[l:m + 1]
        R = arr[m + 1:r + 1]
        i = 0
        j = 0
        k = l
        c = 0
        while i < len(L) and j < len(R):
            if L[i] < R[j]:
                arr[k] = L[i]
                d[L[i]] = d.get(L[i], 0) + c
                i += 1
                k += 1
            else:
                arr[k] = R[j]
                c += 1
                j += 1
                k += 1
        while j < len(R):
            arr[k] = R[j]
            c += 1
            j += 1
            k += 1
        while i < len(L):
            arr[k] = L[i]
            d[L[i]] = d.get(L[i], 0) + c
            i += 1
            k += 1

    def mergesort(i, j):
        if j - i > 0:
            m = i + (j - i) // 2
            mergesort(i, m)
            mergesort(m + 1, j)
            merge(i, m, j)
    ans = []
    du = arr[:]
    mergesort(0, n - 1)
    for i in du:
        ans.append(n - 1 - d.get(i, 0))
        n += 1
    return ans

                arr[k] = L[i]
                d[L[i]] = d.get(L[i], -1) + c
                i += 1
                k += 1
            else:
                arr[k] = R[j]
                c += 1
                j += 1
                k += 1
        while j < len(R):
            arr[k] = R[j]
            c += 1
            j += 1
            k += 1
        while i < len(L):
            arr[k] = L[i]
            d[L[i]] = d.get(L[i], 0) + c
            i += 1
            k += 1

    def mergesort(i, j):
        if j - i > 0:
            m = i + (j - i) // 2
            mergesort(i, m)
            mergesort(m + 1, j)
            merge(i, m, j)
    ans = []
    du = arr[:]
    mergesort(0, n - 1)
    for i in du:
        ans.append(n - 1 - d.get(i, 0))
        n -= 1
    return ans

def find_surpasser_counts(arr, n):
    d = {}

    def merge(l, m, r):
        L = arr[l:m + 1]
        R = arr[m + 1:r + 1]
        i = 0
        j = 0
        k = l
        c = 0
        while i < len(L) and j < len(R):
            if L[i] < R[j]:
                arr[k] = L[i]
                d[L[i]] = d.get(L[i], 1) + c
                i += 1
                k += 1
            else:
                arr[k] = R[j]
                c += 1
                j += 1
                k += 1
        while j < len(R):
            arr[k] = R[j]
            c += 1
            j += 1
            k += 1
        while i < len(L):
            arr[k] = L[i]
            d[L[i]] = d.get(L[i], 0) + c
            i += 1
            k += 1

    def mergesort(i, j):
        if j - i > 0:
            m = i + (j - i) // 2
            mergesort(i, m)
            mergesort(m + 1, j)
            merge(i, m, j)
    ans = []
    du = arr[:]
    mergesort(0, n - 1)
    for i in du:
        ans.append(n - 1 - d.get(i, 0))
        n -= 1
    return ans
